name: isDefined
description: Evaluates a string value to determine whether the variable named in it exists.

params.name: variable_name
params.description: A string expression containing the name of a variable to check the existence of. Only simple dotted notation is supported (for example `myVar`, `arguments.myArg`, `myStruct.key`). Square bracket notation to reference array elements or struct keys is not supported.

links.title: structKeyExists() vs isDefined()
links.description: An Adobe Forums discussion on the differences between structKeyExists() and isDefined().

links.title: Variable Naming Rules
links.description: Adobe Documentation defining valid variable names

examples.title: Using IsDefined
examples.description: Checking for the existence of a `form` variable.

examples.title: Scope Evaluation Order and Unscoped Variables
examples.description: Beware of scope evaluation order when checking for an unscoped variable name.
examples.code: url.foo = "url.foo" ; form.foo = "form.foo"; writeoutput("Is 'foo' defined? " & isDefined("foo")); writeoutput(isDefined("foo") ? " (" & foo & ")" : "");

examples.title: Dot-notation Variable Names
examples.description: Potentially unexpected behavior when checking for a dot-notation variable containing a scope name.
examples.code:
local["form.submit"] = "local['form.submit']" ; form.submit = "form.submit"; writeoutput("Is 'form.submit' defined?" & isDefined("form.submit")); writeoutput(isDefined("form.submit") ? " (" & form.submit & ")" : ""); writeoutput("
"); writeoutput("Is 'submit' defined? " & isDefined("submit")); writeoutput(isDefined("submit") ? " (" & submit & ")" : "");
